abstract: Google plans to announce a partnership with Nielsen to give advertisers a better snapshot of how many people are viewing television commercials on a second-by-second basis.
snippet: Google plans to announce a partnership with Nielsen to give advertisers a better snapshot of how many people are viewing television commercials on a second-by-second basis.
lead_paragraph: Google, which dominates the market for advertising on the Internet, seems to be hoping to do the same thing on television.

headline.main: In Foray Into TV, Google Is to Track Ad Audiences
headline.print_headline: In Foray Into TV, Google Is to Track Ad Audiences

abstract: Microsoft and Google are each vying to take a stake of between 5 percent and 10 percent in Facebook, with a deal expected to be announced in the next 24 to 48 hours, according to The New York Post.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft and Google are each vying to take a stake of between 5 percent and 10 percent in Facebook, with a deal expected to be announced in the next 24 to 48 hours, according to The New York Post.

headline.main: In Facebook Race, Google Said to Be Hiking Price

abstract: Facebook is about to pick between offers from Google and Microsoft to buy a small share in the company at a huge value. This is great for Facebook, but for the potential investors, it is somewhere between irrelevant and insane.
snippet: Facebook is about to pick between offers from Google and Microsoft to buy a small share in the company at a huge value. This is great for Facebook, but for the potential investors, it is somewhere between irrelevant and insane.
lead_paragraph: As  nearly everyone in Silicon Valley has been buzzing about for weeks, Facebook is about to pick between offers from Google and Microsoft to buy a small share in the company at a huge value.

abstract: Some 300 analysts and investors are gathered at the Googleplex for its Analyst Day. No confirmation so far of rumors about Google and Microsoft bidding for a stake in Facebook.
snippet: Some 300 analysts and investors are gathered at the Googleplex for its Analyst Day. No confirmation so far of rumors about Google and Microsoft bidding for a stake in Facebook.
lead_paragraph: See all posts about Google Analyst Day here.

headline.main: Google Analyst Day (1): Demos, but Nothing on Facebook

abstract: Google boasts that its huge advertising business has much more room to grow.
snippet: Google boasts that its huge advertising business has much more room to grow.
lead_paragraph: See all posts about Google Analyst Day here.

abstract: Microsoft has won a high-profile technology industry battle with Google and Yahoo to invest in the social networking upstart Facebook.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft has won a high-profile technology industry battle with Google and Yahoo to invest in the social networking upstart Facebook.

headline.main: Microsoft to Pay $240 Million for Facebook Stake

abstract: Microsoft said it would invest $240 million in Facebook. The money will help Facebook challenge Google and by extension help Microsoft.
snippet: Microsoft said it would invest $240 million in Facebook. The money will help Facebook challenge Google and by extension help Microsoft.

headline.main: Microsoft Wins One in the War Against Google
